The compact SUV gets major updates in terms of exterior styling, features, specs, performance and safety. Check these to know more about the XUV 3XO: Mahindra XUV 3XO Launched: Gets ADAS, Panoramic Sunroof & More, Price Starts At Rs 7.49 Lakh Mahindra XUV 3XO: From Design to Power; All You Need to Know About the Facelifted Mahindra XUV300 Key Highlights Exterior & Design Although the Mahindra XUV 3XO is not a generational upgrade of the XUV300, it still gets a major overhaul in terms of exterior design & styling. In the front, the upper grille is now a closed unit with glossy black finish. It comes embedded with six vertical slots and the twin peak Mahindra logo. Also, the headlamp units now come with bi-functional LED projector and C-shaped edge mounted vertical LED DRLs. The rear of the vehicle has also been updated with a full width connected LED light bar, new bumper with reflectors and silver colour skid plate like finish at the very bottom. The side profile of the compact SUV remains more or less the same as the pre-facelift XUV300. The only difference in the side profile is the new larger 17 inch dual tone alloys and the thicker cladding all around. Interior & Features Coming to the dashboard, door trims and the overall cabin, the XUV 3XO now feels more premium because of the use of soft touch materials on the upper dashboard and door trims. The sound system is now a 7 speaker unit from Harman Kardon. Also, Mahindra has improved the cabin insulation, resulting in lower NVH (engine/road/tyre/wind noise). output.formatted_report_T002:
📊 Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Report

🎯 Executive Summary

This report provides an overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features, specifications, and design elements. The XUV 3XO is a compact SUV known for its modern features and competitive pricing. It offers a blend of performance and comfort, making it a strong contender in its segment.

⚙️ Specifications

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with both petrol and diesel engine options. The petrol engine is a 1.2-litre turbo-petrol unit, while the diesel engine is a 1.5-litre unit. It comes with manual and automatic transmission options. Key specifications include:

  • Engine: 1.2L Turbo Petrol, 1.5L Diesel
  • Transmission: Manual, Automatic
  • Seating Capacity: 5

✨ Key Features

The XUV 3XO boasts several standout features:

  • Panoramic Sunroof: Largest in the segment.
  • Level 2 ADAS: Features like forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control.
  • Soft-touch Materials: On dashboard and door pads.
  • 1.2-litre Turbo-petrol Engine: Delivers 130PS/230Nm, most powerful in its class.

🚗 Exterior Design

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a redesigned exterior with a new front grille, LED headlamps, and a connected LED light bar at the rear. The side profile remains similar to the XUV300 but includes larger 17-inch alloy wheels and thicker cladding.

🛋️ Interior and Features

The interior of the XUV 3XO includes soft-touch materials on the dashboard and door trims, enhancing the overall cabin feel. It also features a 7-speaker Harman Kardon sound system and improved cabin insulation for reduced noise. Key interior features include a panoramic sunroof, dual-zone climate control, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and wireless Android Auto/Apple CarPlay.

Check these to know more about the XUV 3XO: Mahindra XUV 3XO Launched: Gets ADAS, Panoramic Sunroof & More, Price Starts At Rs 7.49 Lakh Mahindra XUV 3XO: From Design to Power; All You Need to Know About the Facelifted Mahindra XUV300 Key Highlights Exterior & Design Although the Mahindra XUV 3XO is not a generational upgrade of the XUV300, it still gets a major overhaul in terms of exterior design & styling. In the front, the upper grille is now a closed unit with glossy black finish. It comes embedded with six vertical slots and the twin peak Mahindra logo. Also, the headlamp units now come with bi-functional LED projector and C-shaped edge mounted vertical LED DRLs. The rear of the vehicle has also been updated with a full width connected LED light bar, new bumper with reflectors and silver colour skid plate like finish at the very bottom. The side profile of the compact SUV remains more or less the same as the pre-facelift XUV300. The only difference in the side profile is the new larger 17 inch dual tone alloys and the thicker cladding all around. Interior & Features Coming to the dashboard, door trims and the overall cabin, the XUV 3XO now feels more premium because of the use of soft touch materials on the upper dashboard and door trims. The sound system is now a 7 speaker unit from Harman Kardon. Also, Mahindra has improved the cabin insulation, resulting in lower NVH (engine/road/tyre/wind noise). On the features front, the XUV 3XO comes with a multitude of first and best in segment features. 📊 Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Report

🎯 Executive Summary

This report provides an overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features, specifications, and design elements. The XUV 3XO is a compact SUV known for its modern features and competitive pricing. It offers a blend of performance and comfort, making it a strong contender in its segment.

⚙️ Specifications

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with both petrol and diesel engine options. The petrol engine is a 1.2-litre turbo-petrol unit, while the diesel engine is a 1.5-litre unit. It comes with manual and automatic transmission options. Key specifications include:

  • Engine: 1.2L Turbo Petrol, 1.5L Diesel
  • Transmission: Manual, Automatic
  • Seating Capacity: 5

✨ Key Features

The XUV 3XO boasts several standout features:

  • Panoramic Sunroof: Largest in the segment.
  • Level 2 ADAS: Features like forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control.
  • Soft-touch Materials: On dashboard and door pads.
  • 1.2-litre Turbo-petrol Engine: Delivers 130PS/230Nm, most powerful in its class.

🚗 Exterior Design

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a redesigned exterior with a new front grille, LED headlamps, and a connected LED light bar at the rear. The side profile remains similar to the XUV300 but includes larger 17-inch alloy wheels and thicker cladding.

🛋️ Interior and Features

The interior of the XUV 3XO includes soft-touch materials on the dashboard and door trims, enhancing the overall cabin feel. It also features a 7-speaker Harman Kardon sound system and improved cabin insulation for reduced noise. Key interior features include a panoramic sunroof, dual-zone climate control, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and wireless Android Auto/Apple CarPlay.

output.formatted_report_T002:
📊 Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Analysis Report

🎯 Executive Summary

This report provides a detailed analysis of the features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, categorized by Safety, Performance, Technology, and Comfort. The analysis is based on data extracted from multiple sources, including Mahindra's official website and various automotive news and review sites. The goal is to provide potential customers with a comprehensive overview of the vehicle's features, specifications, benefits, and user reviews.

🛡️ Safety Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with a comprehensive suite of features. Key safety components include:

  • Airbags: Equipped with multiple airbags to protect occupants in the event of a collision.
  • ABS (Anti-lock Braking System): Prevents wheel lock-up during braking, enhancing control.
  • Level 2 ADAS (Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems): Includes features like forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control to aid drivers.

According to CarDekho, the XUV 3XO includes standout safety features such as Level 2 ADAS with forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control.

🚀 Performance Features

The XUV 3XO offers robust performance through its engine and transmission options:

  • Engine Options: Available with both petrol and diesel engines. The petrol engine is a 1.2-litre turbo-petrol that makes 130PS/230Nm, noted as the most powerful in its class by CarDekho. The diesel engine has a displacement of 1498 cc with a maximum power of 115.05 kW @3750rpm and maximum torque of 300Nm@1500-2500rpm.
  • Transmission: Offered with both Manual & Automatic transmission options.
  • Mileage: The XUV 3XO has a mileage of 17.96 to 20.6 kmpl depending on the variant and fuel type, as stated by CarDekho.

Jubilant Mahindra provides specifications for the diesel variant, which includes a 6-speed gearbox and a fuel tank capacity of 42.0 liters.

💻 Technology Features

The XUV 3XO is packed with technology features, including:

  • Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system with wireless Android Auto/Apple CarPlay.
  • Digital Instrument Cluster: Fully digital instrument cluster with customizable screens.
  • Connectivity: Wireless charging.

Carwale mentions that top-spec versions get dual-zone climate control with rear AC vents. Jubilant Mahindra specifies the inclusion of features like Power Steering, Air Conditioner, and Automatic Climate Control.

🛋️ Comfort Features

Comfort is a key focus in the XUV 3XO, with features like:

  • Panoramic Sunroof: Largest in the segment, according to CarDekho.
  • Ventilated Seats: Provide enhanced comfort in hot weather.
  • Adjustable Seating: Height adjustable driver seat and adjustable headrests.

Other comfort features include rear AC vents, cruise control, and parking sensors (front & rear), as detailed by CarDekho.

💰 Variants and Pricing

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, with prices ranging from Rs. 7.99 Lakh to Rs. 15.80 Lakh (Avg. ex-showroom), according to Carwale. The base model is the XUV 3XO MX1 1.2 Petrol, while the top model is the XUV 3XO AX7L 1.2 Petrol AT.

🚗 Exterior and Design

The XUV 3XO features a refreshed exterior design. Notable elements include:

  • Front Design: Upper grille with a closed unit and glossy black finish, embedded with six vertical slots and the twin peak Mahindra logo, as noted by Carbike360.
  • Headlamps: Bi-functional LED projector headlamp units with C-shaped edge-mounted vertical LED DRLs.
  • Rear Design: Full-width connected LED light bar and a new bumper with reflectors.
  • Wheels: New larger 17-inch dual-tone alloys.

💺 Interior and Features

The interior of the XUV 3XO includes:

  • Dashboard and Door Trims: Use of soft-touch materials for a more premium feel.
  • Sound System: 7-speaker unit from Harman Kardon.
  • Improved Insulation: Lower NVH (engine/road/tyre/wind noise).

⛽ Fuel Efficiency

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers competitive mileage:

  • Petrol: ARAI mileage of 18.2 kmpl.
  • Diesel: Mileage of 20.6 kmpl.

📏 Dimensions and Capacity

Key dimensions and capacity details:

  • Length: 3990 mm
  • Width: 1821 mm
  • Height: 1647 mm
  • Wheelbase: 2600 mm
  • Boot Space: 364 Litres
  • Seating Capacity: 5

⚙️ Suspension, Steering & Brakes

The XUV 3XO is equipped with:

  • Front Suspension: MacPherson Strut suspension
  • Rear Suspension: Rear twist beam
  • Steering Type: Electric
  • Turning Radius: 5.3 m
  • Front Brake Type: Disc
  • Rear Brake Type: Disc

⚔️ Competitive Positioning

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes in the compact SUV segment. Its standout features, such as the panoramic sunroof, Level 2 ADAS, and powerful engine, position it as a strong contender against other vehicles in its class.

⭐ User Reviews and Ratings

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has received positive user ratings. Carwale indicates a user rating of 4.6 based on 557 reviews. Carbike360 reports a rating of 4.9 based on 7 reviews.

📈 Market Trends & Insights

The compact SUV market is competitive, with increasing demand for vehicles that offer a blend of style, features, and performance. The XUV 3XO is strategically positioned to capitalize on this trend with its comprehensive feature set and competitive pricing.

🎯 Strategic Recommendations

For potential customers, the Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a compelling package with its blend of safety, performance, technology, and comfort features. It is recommended to consider the specific variant based on individual needs and preferences.

⚠️ Risk Factors and Uncertainties

Several factors could influence the XUV 3XO's success in the market:

  • Market Competition: The compact SUV segment is highly competitive, with numerous established players.
  • Economic Conditions: Economic downturns could impact consumer spending and demand for vehicles.
  • Supply Chain Disruptions: Disruptions in the supply chain could affect production and delivery timelines.
  • Regulatory Changes: Changes in automotive regulations could impact vehicle specifications and pricing.

Uncertainties & Missing Info: While information on specifications and features is generally consistent across sources, some details such as cargo volume and specific feature availability across all variants could benefit from further clarification from Mahindra.

🕵️ Hidden Signals and Meta Observations

The strong emphasis on technology and safety features suggests Mahindra is targeting a tech-savvy and safety-conscious consumer base. The inclusion of Level 2 ADAS and a panoramic sunroof indicates a focus on delivering a premium driving experience.

The positive user reviews and ratings suggest the XUV 3XO is well-received by customers and meets their expectations. The competitive pricing further enhances its appeal in the market.

📜 Source Citations

  1. Mahindra XUV 3XO Official Website
  2. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications - Jubilant Motor Works
  3. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications - CarDekho
  4. Mahindra XUV 3XO Price, Images, Colours & Reviews - CarWale
  5. Mahindra XUV 3XO 2025 Price, Images, Colors, Specifications, Features and Review - CarBike360

📊 COMPREHENSIVE Mahindra XUV 3XO ANALYSIS REPORT

🎯 Executive Summary

This report provides a detailed analysis of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, a compact SUV known for its features, performance, and design. The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants with both petrol and diesel engine options. Key highlights include its panoramic sunroof, Level 2 ADAS, and a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system. This report aggregates information from various sources to provide a comprehensive overview of the vehicle.

🔍 Market Landscape Overview

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes in the compact SUV segment, which is characterized by high demand and competition. Key competitors include models from Tata, Hyundai, and Kia. The XUV 3XO aims to differentiate itself through its advanced features, competitive pricing, and robust build quality. The segment is driven by consumers looking for a blend of city drivability and ruggedness.

⚙️ Specifications

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers both petrol and diesel engine options, with manual and automatic transmission choices. Key specifications include:

  • Engine: mStallion (TGDi) Petrol and Diesel
  • Displacement: 1197 cc (Petrol) and 1498 cc (Diesel)
  • Max Power: 128.73 bhp (Petrol) and 115.05 kW (Diesel)
  • Max Torque: 230 Nm (Petrol) and 300 Nm (Diesel)
  • Transmission: Manual and Automatic
  • Fuel Type: Petrol and Diesel
  • Mileage: 17.96 to 21.2 kmpl
  • Seating Capacity: 5

✨ Key Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO comes with a range of features designed to enhance comfort, convenience, and safety. Notable features include:

  • Panoramic Sunroof: Largest in the segment
  • Level 2 ADAS: Includes Forward Collision Warning and Adaptive Cruise Control
  • Infotainment: 10.25-inch Touchscreen with Wireless Android Auto/Apple CarPlay
  • Safety: 6 Airbags
  • Other: Dual Zone Climate Control, Rear AC Vents, 7-speaker Harman Kardon Sound System

🚗 Variants and Pricing

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, catering to different customer needs and price points. The base model starts at Rs. 7.99 Lakh, while the top model is priced at Rs. 15.80 Lakh (Ex-showroom Price New Delhi). Some of the key variants include MX1, MX2 Pro, MX3, AX5, and AX7L.

Variant Breakdown:

  • MX Series: Base models with essential features
  • AX Series: Higher-end models with advanced features like ADAS and panoramic sunroof

🎨 Exterior Design

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a modern and stylish exterior design. Key elements include:

  • Front: Closed upper grille with glossy black finish, bi-functional LED projector headlamps, and C-shaped LED DRLs
  • Rear: Full-width connected LED light bar, new bumper with reflectors, and silver color skid plate

📊 Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Report

🎯 Executive Summary

This report provides an overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features, specifications, and design elements. The XUV 3XO is a compact SUV known for its modern features and competitive pricing. It offers a blend of performance and comfort, making it a strong contender in its segment.

⚙️ Specifications

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with both petrol and diesel engine options. The petrol engine is a 1.2-litre turbo-petrol unit, while the diesel engine is a 1.5-litre unit. It comes with manual and automatic transmission options. Key specifications include:

  • Engine: 1.2L Turbo Petrol, 1.5L Diesel
  • Transmission: Manual, Automatic
  • Seating Capacity: 5

✨ Key Features

The XUV 3XO boasts several standout features:

  • Panoramic Sunroof: Largest in the segment.
  • Level 2 ADAS: Features like forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control.
  • Soft-touch Materials: On dashboard and door pads.
  • 1.2-litre Turbo-petrol Engine: Delivers 130PS/230Nm, most powerful in its class.

🚗 Exterior Design

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a redesigned exterior with a new front grille, LED headlamps, and a connected LED light bar at the rear. The side profile remains similar to the XUV300 but includes larger 17-inch alloy wheels and thicker cladding.

🛋️ Interior and Features

The interior of the XUV 3XO includes soft-touch materials on the dashboard and door trims, enhancing the overall cabin feel. It also features a 7-speaker Harman Kardon sound system and improved cabin insulation for reduced noise. Key interior features include a panoramic sunroof, dual-zone climate control, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and wireless Android Auto/Apple CarPlay.
